answers.author: John Manahan
answers.text:
Much of my career in public service, and later in consulting, involved budgeting and understanding budgeting business processes. "Budget guys" like me enjoy learning lots about lots of different functions, and that was what I enjoyed the most. As Tim Cox noted, city management involves multiple businesses, and learning how things get done - and how to help folks do things better - is fun and worth doing!

answers.author: Tim Cox
answers.text:
Working in local government management allows you to face new problems each day/week/month. Many of the challenges and opportunities are unique. 
I am finding that managing a city is the equivalent of managing multiple small businesses. Between Police, Fire, Water, Finance, Engineering, Public Works, HR, Code Enforcement, Legal and so on, there are so many issues that pop up on a daily basis.

answers.author: Toy Beeninga
answers.text:
Building blocks were one of my favorite "toys" growing up.  I could build a castle, a fort, a racetrack, a giant wall, anything I could dream of, I could just build it with those little square blocks. Working in local government is pretty similar to my childhood play-time.  If I, or anyone in the community, can imagine a way to build a better community, we get to spend our days building that community with slightly larger "building-blocks". We can make a positive difference where we live and build a super-cool community.  Everyday is playtime when you are building a community.

answers.author: Alonzo Linan
answers.text:
You get to help people who trust that you're doing the right thing for the right reasons.  Consider how much thought you put into the water you drink, the traffic signal that tells you it's safe to go, the light that turns on at night or the police that will answer anytime you call.  That's what makes this cool!  We are trusted to help make people's lives better, safer, and brighter.

answers.author: J. Munger
answers.text:
The great advantage of working in a Budget Office is that I get exposure to many of the detailed projects the county is working on. From understanding FAA Regulations concerning runway construction and flight paths, to the difference a foot can make in a port's channel, and the pros and cons of self-insuring for health benefits, I have gotten some great understanding of some many complex issues. So for someone who isn't singularly focused in one area, local government work can allow you to never ever get bored with your job.

answers.author: Tom Homan
answers.text:
My interest in local government management as a career was sparked by an internship I had while I was a graduate student at New York University studying for my master’s degree in Public Administration.    Obviously, I was interested in government administration to begin with, but my internship assisting the Village Manager of the Village of Croton-on-Hudson, New York  introduced me to the career of local government management.  The experience made me realize I preferred working at the local level (as compared to working for state or Federal government) because of the variety of the work (no two days are the same), the direct interaction with citizens and community members and the rewards of seeing the fruits of your efforts in your own community.

author: Robert Carty
text:
We all know that local government is where it's at. And that you can make the greatest difference for the most people, more so and more immediately than any other branch of the public sector. 
So, if you were talking to a group of students, say third graders. Or eighth graders, or 11th graders...and you had to explain why, without a fire hose or a badge, how your job is the coolest there is, what would you say? 
Thank you for your feedback!
title: What is cool about your job?
